title: George Fernandes
summary: George Mathew Fernandes[2] (3 June 1930 â€“ 29 January 2019) was an Indian trade unionist, statesman,[3] journalist,[4] and member of Rajya Sabha from Bihar for a short while, and a member of Lok Sabha for a very long period, starting from Bombay (present-day Mumbai) in 1967 but mostly representing Bihar.[5] He was a key member of the Janata Dal and the founder of the Samata Party. He held several ministerial portfolios including communication , industry, railways, and defence.[6]
